title: About the Five College Center for World Languages

media:group.media:title: About the Five College Center for World Languages
media:group.media:description: The Five College Center for World Languages offers classes in less-commonly taught languages to students from the Five Colleges (Amherst, Hampshire, Mount Holyoke, and Smith colleges and the University of Massachusetts Amherst). Founded in 1991, the Center offers courses for academic credit in more than 40 languages through an innovative pedagogical model and an emphasis on real-world conversation. Learn more at fivecolleges.edu/fclang.
